page.title: 03LANDSCAPE AND BUILDINGS
page.content: Rural landscape featuring steep hills and wooded valleys.Fields of between one and 10 acres enclosed with Devon banks,hedgerows and occasional coppic- es. Winding narrow lanes. Small tower- ed church at Sydenham Damerel and 19th centuary chapel.The 19th C.schoolhouse in Sydenham has been converted to a private dwelling.Large farmhouses at Collacombe Barton,Hardicott and Won- wood.The 14th C.building at Collacombe Barton is a listed building. In the Great Hall,the big window has 3400 panes,the chimney, very fine plaster- work,dated 1574, above which is the Tremayne Coat of Arms. On another wall is a Royal Coat of Arms of Q.Eliz.1. There are 3 little windows looking down from the solar.The archway lead- ing to house,of earliest Italian ren- aissance influence.Disused mines/shaft around.Little remains mine buildings.
